intro: Psychilis domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican psychilis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
